meanings.definition: Not able to be endured or tolerated.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was unendurable for the baby.
meanings.sent2: The unbearable heat made everyone seek shade.
meanings.sent3: The unendurable tickling sensation made her burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The unendurable wait for the results felt like an eternity.
meanings.sent5: The unendurable stench from the garbage dump lingered in the air.

meanings.definition: Too painful or difficult to bear.
meanings.sent1: The unendurable toothache kept him up all night.
meanings.sent2: The athlete pushed through the unendurable pain to finish the race.
meanings.sent3: The unendurable taste of the medicine made her cringe.
meanings.sent4: The unendurable loss of a loved one left a void in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The unendurable weight of the burden crushed his spirit.
